ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about Naples in general. I also got to expand on my Italian vocabulary to include words related to a historical context.
The course gave me a new perspective on the language and culture of the region. It was fascinating to learn about all the changes in the ruling power which shaped the city.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really liked the fact that the course was somewhat revolved around what we as students wanted to focus on. Anna always made sure that were were actually interested and if a topic didn't interest us, we would modify it in a way that would.

The content of the class is very student driven. If there is something you are interested in Anna will make it part of the course. The required books are definitely a hard read for an L5 class and more in class focus in understanding them would have been helpful.
It is a wonderful course that goes at a good pace. It is difficult to mention any weaknesses because I really liked it. I would like to see more focus on the modern day Naples.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this class to another student. It is a great course if you want to keep up with your Italian but do not have time / do not want to take the traditional L5 class. You learn a lot of interesting things and the midterm/final papers were actually fun because you are given the liberty to write about practically any topic you want (as long as it is relevant to the class).
Take this course! Anna is simply wonderful! You will fall in love with Naples and Yale's Italian department.
Yes!!! If you are at all interested about Naples or just Italian as a language, this class is engaging and fun.

It is a great course! Take it! Professor Iacovella is a pleasure to study under. She has all the insights since she is from Naples. You will not only improve your Italian but also learn the history and linguistic characteristics of the Neapolitan.
